data.title: Boy in custody after shooting gel bead gun in crowded theater, police say
data.meta_description: Police say the juvenile who shot the toy gun was taken to family court.
data.text:
CREVE COEUR, Mo. (KMOV/Gray News) - Police in Missouri say a juvenile is in custody after he allegedly stood up in a movie theater, pulled out a gel bead gun and began shooting into the crowd.

Gabby Durham hopes to forget the Saturday afternoon incident. She, her husband and her two stepkids were at an AMC movie theater in Creve Coeur to see Pixar’s “Inside Out 2,” KMOV reports.

“I was going to a Disney movie with my family,” Durham said. “I wasn’t going to have a traumatic experience.”

Then, the family saw a teenage boy with a mask on stand in the theater, curse out the crowd and wave around some kind of gun.

“It all happens so fast, and in those situations, I’m not going to really take the time to determine if this is real or if it’s fake,” Durham said.

She immediately had thoughts about the 2012 movie theater shooting in Aurora, Colorado, when a gunman killed 12 people and injured dozens of others.

“I saw orange on the gun, but also, how do you know that it’s not real?” Durham said.

While Durham’s husband attempted to block the family, they quickly realized the teen had a toy gun and gel bullets. They say they got hit with the gel and are OK, but not everybody was at the time.

“There was a little kid who was much closer who got hit, and he was in tears, sobbing,” Durham said.

She says the kid eventually fled the theater.

Creve Coeur Police said in a statement a juvenile was arrested in a nearby parking lot after shooting gel bullets in a theater. They included pictures of a Hydro Strike motorized gel bead blaster.

“My stepson, he was like, ‘Oh, yeah, I’ve seen those Orbeez guns. I knew what that was,” Durham said.

It appears shooting toy guns like these is a popular online trend. Videos with over a million views show teens shooting at friends and sometimes strangers.

Durham hopes the trend ends soon.

“Why is this the world we live in? Why is this something we need to worry about happening?” she said.

Police say the juvenile who shot the gun was taken to St. Louis County Family Court. No injuries were reported in the incident.

Police say more information will be released as the investigation develops. They ask anyone who witnessed the incident to contact them at 314-737-4600.
